00129         BT_DECLARE_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR();
00130 
00131         enum CollisionFlags
00132         {
00133                 CF_STATIC_OBJECT= 1,
00134                 CF_KINEMATIC_OBJECT= 2,
00135                 CF_NO_CONTACT_RESPONSE = 4,
00136                 CF_CUSTOM_MATERIAL_CALLBACK = 8,//this allows per-triangle material (friction/restitution)
00137                 CF_CHARACTER_OBJECT = 16,
00138                 CF_DISABLE_VISUALIZE_OBJECT = 32, //disable debug drawing
00139                 CF_DISABLE_SPU_COLLISION_PROCESSING = 64,//disable parallel/SPU processing
00140                 CF_HAS_CONTACT_STIFFNESS_DAMPING = 128,
00141                 CF_HAS_CUSTOM_DEBUG_RENDERING_COLOR = 256,
00142                 CF_HAS_FRICTION_ANCHOR = 512,
00143                 CF_HAS_COLLISION_SOUND_TRIGGER = 1024
00144         };
00145 
00146         enum    CollisionObjectTypes
00147         {
00148                 CO_COLLISION_OBJECT =1,
00149                 CO_RIGID_BODY=2,
00152                 CO_GHOST_OBJECT=4,
00153                 CO_SOFT_BODY=8,
00154                 CO_HF_FLUID=16,
00155                 CO_USER_TYPE=32,
00156                 CO_FEATHERSTONE_LINK=64
00157         };
00158 
00159         enum AnisotropicFrictionFlags
00160         {
00161                 CF_ANISOTROPIC_FRICTION_DISABLED=0,
00162                 CF_ANISOTROPIC_FRICTION = 1,
00163                 CF_ANISOTROPIC_ROLLING_FRICTION = 2
00164         };
00165 
00166         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool mergesSimulationIslands() const
00167         {
00169                 return  ((m_collisionFlags & (CF_STATIC_OBJECT | CF_KINEMATIC_OBJECT | CF_NO_CONTACT_RESPONSE) )==0);
00170         }
00171 
00172         const btVector3& getAnisotropicFriction() const
00173         {
00174                 return m_anisotropicFriction;
00175         }
00176         void    setAnisotropicFriction(const btVector3& anisotropicFriction, int frictionMode = CF_ANISOTROPIC_FRICTION)
00177         {
00178                 m_anisotropicFriction = anisotropicFriction;
00179                 bool isUnity = (anisotropicFriction[0]!=1.f) || (anisotropicFriction[1]!=1.f) || (anisotropicFriction[2]!=1.f);
00180                 m_hasAnisotropicFriction = isUnity?frictionMode : 0;
00181         }
00182         bool    hasAnisotropicFriction(int frictionMode = CF_ANISOTROPIC_FRICTION) const
00183         {
00184                 return (m_hasAnisotropicFriction&frictionMode)!=0;
00185         }
00186 
00189         void    setContactProcessingThreshold( btScalar contactProcessingThreshold)
00190         {
00191                 m_contactProcessingThreshold = contactProcessingThreshold;
00192         }
00193         btScalar        getContactProcessingThreshold() const
00194         {
00195                 return m_contactProcessingThreshold;
00196         }
00197 
00198         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool          isStaticObject() const {
00199                 return (m_collisionFlags & CF_STATIC_OBJECT) != 0;
00200         }
00201 
00202         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool          isKinematicObject() const
00203         {
00204                 return (m_collisionFlags & CF_KINEMATIC_OBJECT) != 0;
00205         }
00206 
00207         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool          isStaticOrKinematicObject() const
00208         {
00209                 return (m_collisionFlags & (CF_KINEMATIC_OBJECT | CF_STATIC_OBJECT)) != 0 ;
00210         }
00211 
00212         SIMD_FORCE_INLINE bool          hasContactResponse() const {
00213                 return (m_collisionFlags & CF_NO_CONTACT_RESPONSE)==0;
00214         }

00221         virtual void    setCollisionShape(btCollisionShape* collisionShape)

00223                 m_updateRevision++;

00225                 m_rootCollisionShape = collisionShape;

00238         void    setIgnoreCollisionCheck(const btCollisionObject* co, bool ignoreCollisionCheck)
00239         {
00240                 if (ignoreCollisionCheck)
00241                 {
00242                         //We don't check for duplicates. Is it ok to leave that up to the user of this API?
00243                         //int index = m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.findLinearSearch(co);
00244                         //if (index == m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.size())
00245                         //{
00246                         m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.push_back(co);
00247                         //}
00248                 }
00249                 else
00250                 {
00251                         m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.remove(co);
00252                 }
00253                 m_checkCollideWith = m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.size() > 0;
00254         }
00255 
00256         virtual bool    checkCollideWithOverride(const btCollisionObject*  co) const
00257         {
00258                 int index = m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.findLinearSearch(co);
00259                 if (index < m_objectsWithoutCollisionCheck.size())
00260                 {
00261                         return false;
00262                 }
00263                 return true;
00264         }

00341     void        setContactStiffnessAndDamping(btScalar stiffness, btScalar damping)
00342         {
00343                 m_updateRevision++;
00344                 m_contactStiffness = stiffness;
00345                 m_contactDamping = damping;
00346                 
00347                 m_collisionFlags |=CF_HAS_CONTACT_STIFFNESS_DAMPING;
00348                 
00349         //avoid divisions by zero...
00350                 if (m_contactStiffness< SIMD_EPSILON)
00351         {
00352             m_contactStiffness = SIMD_EPSILON;
00353         }
00354         }

00563         void    setCustomDebugColor(const btVector3& colorRGB)
00564         {
00565                 m_customDebugColorRGB = colorRGB;
00566                 m_collisionFlags |= CF_HAS_CUSTOM_DEBUG_RENDERING_COLOR;
00567         }
00568 
00569         void    removeCustomDebugColor()
00570         {
00571                 m_collisionFlags &= ~CF_HAS_CUSTOM_DEBUG_RENDERING_COLOR;
00572         }
00573 
00574         bool getCustomDebugColor(btVector3& colorRGB) const
00575         {
00576                 bool hasCustomColor = (0!=(m_collisionFlags&CF_HAS_CUSTOM_DEBUG_RENDERING_COLOR));
00577                 if (hasCustomColor)
00578                 {
00579                         colorRGB = m_customDebugColorRGB;
00580                 }
00581                 return hasCustomColor;
00582         }
00583 
00584         inline bool checkCollideWith(const btCollisionObject* co) const
00585         {
00586                 if (m_checkCollideWith)
00587                         return checkCollideWithOverride(co);
00588 
00589                 return true;
00590         }

00602 struct  btCollisionObjectDoubleData
00603 {
00604         void                                    *m_broadphaseHandle;
00605         void                                    *m_collisionShape;
00606         btCollisionShapeData    *m_rootCollisionShape;
00607         char                                    *m_name;
00608 
00609         btTransformDoubleData   m_worldTransform;
00610         btTransformDoubleData   m_interpolationWorldTransform;
00611         btVector3DoubleData             m_interpolationLinearVelocity;
00612         btVector3DoubleData             m_interpolationAngularVelocity;
00613         btVector3DoubleData             m_anisotropicFriction;
00614         double                                  m_contactProcessingThreshold;   
00615         double                                  m_deactivationTime;
00616         double                                  m_friction;
00617         double                                  m_rollingFriction;
00618         double                  m_contactDamping;
00619         double                  m_contactStiffness;
00620         double                                  m_restitution;
00621         double                                  m_hitFraction; 
00622         double                                  m_ccdSweptSphereRadius;
00623         double                                  m_ccdMotionThreshold;
00624 
00625         int                                             m_hasAnisotropicFriction;
00626         int                                             m_collisionFlags;

00629         int                                             m_activationState1;
00630         int                                             m_internalType;

00632 
00633         char    m_padding[4];
00634 };
